alert.note: Alert for Eastern Montgomery; Lower Bucks; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 8:20AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Atlantic, west central Ocean, southeastern Camden, southeastern Mercer, east central Gloucester, Burlington, southwestern Monmouth, east central Montgomery, southeastern Bucks and northeastern Philadelphia Counties through 845 AM EDT... At 820 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Bensalem to near Medford to near Victory Lakes. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Trenton, Bensalem, Evesham, Mount Laurel, Willingboro, Medford, Hammonton, Lumberton, Florence, Burlington, Bristol, Mount Holly, Riverside, Tabernacle, Shamong, Egg Harbor City, Bordentown, Presidential Lakes Estates and Beverly. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 5 and 8. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 347 and 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 31 and 40. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 9. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 38 and 63. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 26 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
